instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
No liquid damage. Both ports are 5v 0.18a drops to 0.02amps then loops over. At times unplugging and plugging back in 20v will appear for a few seconds. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> starts at 12.30v then 12V before looping.

Only getting 5v at <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_AON_CHGR</SIGNAL> so replaced <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> after checking <RESISTOR>R5221</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5262</RESISTOR> were good.

Nothing has changed. Not sure what to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Did you check diode mode at PPBUS/<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> rails?
Remove F5200 and check <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR> voltage.

Post <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
PPBUS 0.490  

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 0.380

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON_ATC_ISNS</SIGNAL> .340

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON_DFR_ISNS</SIGNAL> .340

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> .340

<SIGNAL>3V8_AON_SPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> .340

C250 12.30V with F5200 removed

<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> 5V  

<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> 2.1V

<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL> 0V

VDDA 5.15V

VDDP 5V

<SIGNAL>EN_MVR</SIGNAL> 5V

<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>  1.77V

AMON 0.36V

BMON 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 3.8V

All <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> LDO's loop every few seconds

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check resistance (ohm scale) over <CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR>.
Also check diode mode to ground on all coils of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/8100.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
resistance over <CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR> is in the millions

Diode mode to ground on <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>/<CHIP>U7700</CHIP> found no shorts.

usbc port with UF400 cycles on and off every few seconds. No shorts and both 1.5v and 3.3v LDO's are present

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> is stable?
If not, check RD610 and its traces.
If yes, then all <SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> must be stable.
Unless MPMU detects an overcurrent/short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON_MPMU</SIGNAL>  are stable however <SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> is 0v but not shorted.

<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> is stable as well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You've said before all <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> LDOs loop.

No idea when <SIGNAL>MPMU_VREF_ADC</SIGNAL> should come on; compare with good board.

Now check <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> LDOs...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BUCK4_LX0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V06_SW_DRAM</SIGNAL> appear to be shorted . 0.43 diode mode on good board but only 0.012 on this board.

Tried injecting 1v but nothing gets hot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
0.012 isn't low enough to heat something when inject voltage.
Lift L7440/1 and R770A; check where the low value remains.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: short remains on pad 2 of L7740. Removed every cap on the line but no change. Does this sound like a shorted M1 now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Before M1, remove <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and check again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
